Lv2c4i 06 Jun 2018, 10:09

Nice to see Brooke Shields in spex but hope she's "gone full-time" may be premature. On Getty's online photo site, there are a number of photos from the same event as the one posted. And Shields is wearing a tuxedo-type outfit, typically a man's outfit--and I wonder if the spex are just part of the fashion, well-dressed, highly tailored executive vibe, rather than an alteration of her day-to-day eyewear opting.

On a somewhat related (and sad) note, the death of designer Kate Spade has occasioned remembering her accessory lines and designs, and while glasses have not been specifically noted, a number of photos show her sporting spade eyewear. And she did offer a fashion option for those who chose to wear their glasses. Peace upon all who share her loss.

rafa 23 Feb 2018, 09:12

On Netflix it's worth checking out the film "NEWNESS", starring Spanish actress Laia Costa, who in some scenes wears her prescription minus glasses, whose rx I estimate between -4 or -5. She looks gorgeous in them. It's a pretty good film, actually.

Blind Without 'Em 20 Feb 2018, 08:12

Brenda in Adventures in Babysitting, having her glasses stolen, wanders around the bus station blindly and mistakes a rat for a kitten. (The bag lady who steals them is actually able to see better with them; ironically, in Real Life she'd likely be even blinder trying to wear glasses not prescribed to her.)

Adventures in Dinosaur City: Jamie has her glasses knocked off in a bar fight and is left to crawl around trying to find them. Subverted when one of her friends accidentally steps on them before she can find them; while she's clearly troubled by it, it's not a massive deal to her.

Sheriff Albert Earp in Carry On Cowboy  although he is not really much better with them on.

Delicatessen has a woman who removes her glasses in order to look better for a man she's about to see. She is almost completely blind without them and many times knocks something over or overpours tea. We are given a view of her vision a few times and she's pretty blind.

The title character of Dr. Cyclops. He can't see at all without his coke-bottle spectacles; that's why he summoned the team of scientists to his island, because he needed to use a microscope to perfect his shrinking device, and couldn't use one while wearing them. His miniaturized victims try to take advantage of this by breaking them. They only manage to break one lens, but that blinds him enough for them to trick him into chasing them to a mineshaft, where he plummets to his death.

A mall employee from Eight Legged Freaks, who proved himself Too Dumb to Live by repeatedly taking off his glasses, even when on the run from giant spiders. Eventually, he blindly walks up to one and is killed.

Olivia in Final Destination 5 appears to be this. When she loses her glasses on the bridge she is unable to do anything but stumble around and cry for help. The audience is also shown a brief glimpse of her vision  it's pretty dire.

Sinistra, the bikini-clad temptress in the '60s beach-party film The Ghost in the Invisible Bikini.

Gattaca has Vincent lose his contacts and is thus utterly helpless when he tries to cross a main drag (which is plain dumb in the first place).

The Goonies. Stef loses her glasses early on in the adventure. While she complains a few times about not being able to see, she doesn't seem to have much of a problem throughout the rest of the movie.

Geek Charming: It is revealed halfway throughout the film that Dylan secretly wears contact lenses. However, she accidentally loses one of her contacts and is forced to wear her glasses to school. She tries to not wear them resulting in this trope.

In Guest House Paradiso, Richie donned Eddie's glasses as a disguise. They were both rendered nearly blind as a result.

The film Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban averts this trope nicely when Harry gets his glasses knocked off by the Whomping Willow. This leads to a fuzzy but still somewhat intelligible P.O.V. Shot that's pretty close to what the world looks like through myopia.

In How to Marry a Millionaire, Pola (Marilyn Monroe) is blind without her glasses, and vain enough to always take them off around men. This leads to scenes like pretending to read a book, which she's holding upside down.

Averted in Jurassic Park. At one point, Dennis Nedry loses his glasses. He looks for them for about a second before saying "I can afford more glasses", being in a hurry to catch a ship. His sight is not drastically affected. However, not having his glasses leaves his eyes vulnerable to the spat venom of the Dilophosaurus.

Major League: Pitcher Ricky Vaughn can't make out the strike zone until he's fitted with an embarrassing pair of glasses.

Minority Report has a man say this to very creepy effect. He is standing over his bed (that he caught his wife with another man in) and as he puts his glasses on he's raising a pair of shears about to stab them. Thankfully Precrime foresaw this and arrived in time to stop him.

Done very scarily in The Mummy (1999). When Mr. Burns' glasses get broken in the tunnel, he must feel his way in the dark. He sees the mummy ahead of him, but his eyesight is so bad he's not sure he sees anything. He looks away, then back, only to be sure that someone/something was there because it's now gone. The mummy appears right behind him, so now he can see the mummy up close. He can only scream before he gets his eyes and tongue ripped out. Which then means that the Mummy, having his eyes, is short-sighted. No wonder he later thinks the lead female is his lover. Word of God says this was the idea in the original script, although they never drew explicit attention to it.

My Cousin Vinny: Subverted when the inept defense lawyer tries to discredit a witness by claiming the man couldn't have seen the perps' faces because he wasn't wearing his vital glasses. The witness replies that they're reading glasses.

Also subverted with another witness, who was wearing her glasses when she saw the crime. In this case, though, she's half-blind even with the glasses.

Sorority Boys contains what is probably the stupidest example of this trope ever. It's a drag comedy that expects us to believe that a character without her glasses can't tell the difference between a naked man and a naked woman.

The Spider-Man Trilogy. Pete before getting his powers, and when they start failing.

Donald Sutherland's character in Space Cowboys says he only needs glasses for a few things, like "reading, driving, seeing movies, walking..." He nonetheless passes the NASA eyesight test by memorizing the letters: "I may be blind, but I have a perfect memory!"

In a reversal, although not really a subversion, in Strangers on a Train, Alfred Hitchcock wanted the actress who played Miriam to wear glasses with thick lenses so he could show her murder reflected in them, and to make her resemble another character. The actress, Casey Rogers (billed as Laura Elliott), didn't need glasses, and couldn't see at all with the costume glasses on. She wears the thick lenses for close-up and medium scenes, and plain lenses for long shots, but there are still several scenes where she has to depend on other people to make sure she doesn't trip or stumble when she's wearing the glasses. In the scenes where Miriam goes to the amusement park with two men, she is holding both their arms most of the time because she can't see where she is going.

Straw Dogs (2011): the male protagonist, although it's done poorly and not even referenced until his glasses are knocked off during the climax.

Turkey Shoot has a particularly glaring example: Ritter removes one prisoners

glasses before setting him out on the field.

An important plot point in 12 Angry Men (and the play on which it was based, of course): Juror #9 recalls that a key witness in the murder case had marks on her nose suggesting that she usually wears glasses, though opted not to in court. He points out that she was unlikely to be wearing them in bed late at night when she claims to have seen the murder from all the way across the street, thereby making her less than credible as a witness.

Black Comedy example in Wild Wild West. Artemis Gordon has a device that can project the last thing a murder victim saw before he died, but to do so, he has to mount the victim's decapitated head onto the device. Anyway, at first, the image is very blurry (they can see someone who's obviously General McGrath, but not a paper he's holding) until West notices the victim's glasses on the table and puts them over his eyes. Then they can see the document clearly.

eyegyuru 20 Jan 2018, 15:32

Hi Lou

You are right that she has worn glasses most likely for fashion since 2013. However, the frames that she wore back then are different than the ones she has now, as denoted by the dots near the top left and right of the frames.

2014: http://www.fabulous-emma.com/photos/albums/2020/040.jpg (Notice how there are two dots in a row on her frames)

2018: http://www.fabulous-emma.com/photos/albums/2905/001.jpg (There are three dots in a triangle on her frames, and appears to be a cut for a prescription)

Here is the link to her interview with Stephen Colbert: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tb2ZPmX7t38&t;

Lou 20 Jan 2018, 13:32

Hi

Carrie 22 Nov 2017, 12:33

Hayley Atwell is half English and half American and is currently one of the main characters, Margaret Schlegal, in the BBC period drama series "Howards End" (Gemma and I love a good Sunday evening BBC tv drama.) I wasn't that aware of her until now although her name did sound vaguely familiar. I didn't know she wore glasses until I Googled her. The 3rd photo is from her Instagram page and is dated October 2016.

Apparently, when she was in a film or a tv series a few years ago the director told her she was fat! Looking through loads of photos of her taken over the years she has been acting she is not fat in any of them! She has got quite a big bust but not a big belly. Rude man!

She doesn't wear glasses in Howards End, so I presume she wears contacts or doesn't need glasses full time. The drama is set in early 20th century England which obviously means she couldn't wear her own modern glasses as they would look far too modern.

Crystal Veil 25 Sep 2017, 06:18

Pseldonymov (Sept 5th),

Apologies for the long delay. Anna's photo shoot is on my previous weblog:

lovelyladiesbehindcrystalveil.blogspot.com/

There are 120 photos of her, most of them in front of a large mirror in a trendy boutique. She was one of five models who posed for me in Paris, January last year (see index on top page). Unfortunately Blogger has changed something, maximizing the column on the right to 100 photos. The best way to get access to Anna's photos is to click the year 2016, then the month (either February or more likely, March) and then scroll down the page and click "oudere berichten"). You may have to repeat this procedure 20 or 30 times to reach Anna's photos. But don't worry, they are there.

Best of luck!

It appears that Kelly Ripa may be moving towards full time wear. On her morning talk show, her glasses used to be on the desk. She and Ryan would walk on stage and sit at the desk. She would only put her specs on when she had sometime to read. But this week she has been wearing them walking onto stage and wearing them much more. She still takes them off when interviewing other celebs since she it typically not reading anything then.

Soundmanpt 10 Jun 2017, 07:46

Jan

I'm 68 years old so i very well remember when this battle took place and as crazy as tht movie makes it seem it was really that crazy in real life as well. Bobbi Riggs was a bit of a nut case but this became a major TV event back then and had to be a huge boost to tennis and even more so women's tennis.

I watched the trailer and without a doubt the aviator glasses she wears has a a decent cut-in which you can clearly in her right lens of her glasses at the 00:56 point and in her left lenses at 1:36. The round glasses i couldn't get a good enough look at to determine if they also were prescription but my guess all of the glasses she wears has her actual prescription. i have a feeling since this happened so long ago and I don't know how many people even know who Billy Jean King is or Bobbi Riggs it won't stay on the big screen very long an be available on DVD rather quickly.

You're right it is nice to see more and more TV shows and movies with the main actresses wearing their own prescription in glasses.

Lv2c4i 12 May 2017, 03:23

Watching Kelly Ripa, she is wearing her glasses for all but the first few moments of her daily morning show. Eagle-eyed observers will note that these are a new style of frames. Previously she'd worn (for reading only) a pair of black (or very dark) frames. The current pair is darker on the top of the frames then "fading" to lighter or clear at the bottom. They glasses also look to be a much better fit on her face and so are also more attractive--like she's wearing her glasses rather than just a pair of glasses.

On a recent show (wedn, 5/10?), they also did a spot about the "latest eyewear styles" tho there was not a lot of info and Kelly tried on only two other frame styles, a clear round and a wire round frame. Both looked ok but the ones she's now wearing are more attractive.

Well how strange is this. Just the other night it was Emma Roberts trying on Stephan Colbert's glasses. Last night one of his guests was Marisa Tomei and Mr. Colbert what it would be like to turn one of lady Gaga's song lyrics into a scene from a Broadway play. He pulled on 2 cards with the lyrics written for each of them to read. And then he asked her if she needed her glasses? She said yes and for some reason he had her glasses even in the case. He opened it and handed her glasses to her. She put on but she seemed to have a bit of a problem trying to find the right distance that she was able to read her part from. Her glasses were on the bigger side and several times the way she moved I could see that her glasses had the tell tale line that lined bifocals have. I think she may have already been wearing contacts and that caused her a bit of a problem with trying to read with her glasses. Just interesting that he had 2 female guests that both involved glasses. I'm sure if someone looks there must be pictures from the show.

Soundmanpt 14 Mar 2017, 11:39

Carrie

You posted a set of pictures of Kristen having breakfast with a friend back on "29 Sept 2016 05:16" Quite a few of the pictures if you enlarge them you can clearly see that the glasses she is wearing have noticeable magnification. Also notice the dark circles under her eyes. That is often caused by wearing glasses very often and she doesn't seem to mind wearing glasses so she likely didn't bother doing any makeup and she is dressed very casual so glasses was faster and easier for her. Remember she has been seen many times wearing glasses. Most likely when she isn't on screen she prefers to wear glasses rather than contacts. Don't you get the idea that even though she can glam up when necessary she would rather go casual most often including wearing her glasses. So i seriously think the glasses she is wearing in those pictures "Tiff" posted are her prescription glasses and not "plano".

I was wondering where you have been since I haven't seen any posts from you recently. I assume that you went with Gemma on holiday? I hope you ladies had a really great time.

Soundmanpt 13 Mar 2017, 11:28

Nicola

Thanks for posting the 2 sets of pictures of the very lovely Kate Beckinsale. I wasn't aware that she had lasik. I do recall seeing pictures of her several years ago wearing glasses so she could see the teleprompter. Is there a reason to assume that her glasses are readers other than the fact that it is common for people to need readers much sooner after having lasik. But some also not uncommon for many to become myopic again as well. I think in both sets she appears to have just left a building. So in going outside she likely had only just taken her glasses off so she could wear sunglasses while walking to her car. And because she needs her glasses to see to drive again she didn't bother putting them in her bag. Her sunglasses appear to be non prescription sos once in her car she will put her prescription glasses on again to drive home or where ever she she might be headed.

I know of a several people that had lasik and after a few years with perfect or even better than perfect eyesight needed to start wearing a weak minus prescription again. Two of them were opticians that I know. They both have glasses that are only around -1.00 with no further change in their vision.

gwgs 13 Dec 2016, 02:34

Soundman - I've registered on several sites, two of which have mobile apps and despite both the mobile apps having numerous photos on the profile - one has 5, the other has 7, I've found that the majority of the girls on there aren't glasses wearers. I had thought the same thing as you - they think they're more attractive without glasses - so had swiped through an image or two more of the girls I thought were attractive, but probably only 1 to 3% of the women on there have 1 photo of them in glasses out of the 5-7 photos! More often than not, the glasses also like the dreaded planos!! I've had two "matches" so far and messaged them so we'll have to see how we go although from friends comments, and looking online it says the majority of people don't respond to every match/message

The Spex Dating app that was linked here previously is utterly useless as they literally have only about 5 women on there even when conducting a broad search, and one of them is the founder of the site who isn't single and merely shows her bio!

eyesnap 12 Dec 2016, 10:45

http://girlswithglasses.com/movie-monday-zoom-2/

Soundmanpt 12 Dec 2016, 10:13

gwgs

There is a free dating site that I have checked into and you're right. you see very few young ladies wearing glasses for their main picture. But the site I was in often allowed for several pictures and their you would often see that same woman wearing her glasses. It is only a guess but I suspect that there maybe several reasons why women aren't seen wearing glasses their. One reason is that even though glasses have become much more popular and women are wearing glasses more often many of them still probably feel they are more attractive and thus more appealing to the opposite sex if they aren't wearing glasses. Plus I have seen a good number of young ladies that even though they wear their glasses full time will take their glasses off if they are getting their picture taken. It could be because they figure their eyes can't be seen as well with their glasses on or maybe just a habit they still have.

Pseldonymov 12 Dec 2016, 09:48

gwgs 12 Dec 2016, 02:20

This is true, Soundman and Chris, and whilst we have definitely seen a huge rise in women feeling they are now more socially able to wear glasses instead of contacts / going bare eyed, and wearing their glasses on a day to day basis, I have been surprised by the LACK of girls with glasses on the regular datings apps / websites. When you put in your search perameters and are shown the results, there is probably only 1 out of 30 women that is seeing wearing glasses, and they won't have that as their primary photo. I'm also yet to see someone with strong glasses on any dating app - which on a day to day basis you are likely to encounter 2 or 3 times in a busy city like London.

There must therefore still be some sort of hang up /pre-conception that glasses still aren't as 'cool' as they should be and for 0-0 lovers this is a real disappointment and disappointing to see that despite the leaps and bounds we've made in glasses being more acceptable, they're still not thought of as something that should be featured on profile pics for dating. OR, it could be all of the girls with glasses in the world aren't single!

Soundmanpt 08 Dec 2016, 16:39

chrisb

I think what you have been observing is becoming more and more common now. There is almost certainly a link between people's use of I-Phones and the many other devices with small print on the eyes. Before these things were available even when someone may have needed glasses they were able to get by since their eyes were never exposed to so much small print. And at that same time in history wearing glasses for women wasn't at all a popular thing. So really it seems that all these things just came together at the exact same time. The I-Phone came out, texting became the new way to communicate, people were drawn more and more to these devices and for many trying to see so much small print simply took its toll on their eyes. Now glasses were more than just an option but rather a necessity in order to read all those text messages. Along with more and more people now requiring glasses the glasses companies started providing many more options of frame styles. Glasses now had become fashionable and more accepted as being a normal part of life. Anyway that's the way I see it.

chrisb 08 Dec 2016, 14:08

We can but hope that Emma Ishta's chain sets a trend. It's not often acknowledged but there has been a massive increase in the number of young GWG's. I've remarked before that I believe this and the other Glasses sites we know and love have contributed to this effect.

In my daily journey across the trendy parts of North London I am always amazed by the ratio of GWG vs non GWG among 20-30 year olds (and younger) Perhaps the pervasive smart phone has also contributed. Many seem to have such a low rx and before today's fashion tastes would gone without.

It's also not unusual to see the part time, or perhaps ambivalent wearer with her glasses stuck in her hair.

Of course in the media, glasses on a chain are the antithesis of cool and present a very negative impression.

But lets hope Emma's quite logical mode of glasses / not glasses wearing is going to overturn those negative associations. Come on masters of digital media manipulation, set to work. Let Emma Ishtar be your poster (sic) girl.

Soundmanpt 07 Dec 2016, 15:03

What I think is interesting is that you mostly only ever saw people that needed reading glasses use those type of chains on their glasses. Her glasses are clearly for distance which is easy to tell through her left lens by viewing the words in the background. But I guess it is just her way of having her glasses handy when she needs them rather than just wearing them all the time. By the way I really love her glasses. They appear to be from a company called Artcraft if memory serves me right and I know they are still in business and making the same type of glasses that they made back in the 1940's. I actually have pair just like the ones she is wearing. But mine are actually gold filled and the lenses are glass and the nose pads are made from real ivory.

Lv2c4i 15 Nov 2016, 06:12

Kelly Ripa, actress who has daily talk show in US, seems to have begun wearing her reading glasses pretty much daily. It looks like she "broke down" and admitted her need on the show Friday, Nov 4, and now wears them when she needs to read, often during the "host chat" portion at the beginning of the show, when current celebrity and other "soft" news is discussed. Towards the end of the one hour daily show there is an "Inbox" segment when messages from viewers are read, and here again, the spex come out.

Video is available on the show's website, but have not found any caps.

Soundmanpt 09 Nov 2016, 09:22

Carrie

Just looking at the video loop you posted of the lovely Chloe Moretz and her glasses very clearly have plus lenses. But what I found of interest is that the magnification is noticeable through her left lens near the bottom. But I don't notice see any magnification on the upper part of her lens. So I wonder if she might be wearing progressives or as you call them over their varifocals? Without a doubt she has more than enough money to have her glasses made with either a very weak minus in the distance areas or no prescription at all for distance and a reading add in the lower segment By doing that she can wear her glasses as much as she wishes without having any effect on her being able to see distances perfectly.

gwgs 30 Sep 2016, 13:27

I dont know if this has been posted before, but ive just switched on the James Bond movie from Russia with Love and am 19/20 mins into the movie. One of the Bond girls is being interrogated by an army woman who is wearing extremely strong myopic glasses, verging on myodiscs. What the strange thing is is that she is reading from a piece of paper and acting totally au fait as if these are her real glasses and she is high myope but then in the blink of an eye, she takes them off, puts them on the desk and walks over to the Bond girl continues talking to her and operating perfectly normally without them!

Is she a high myope or not as either way, with or without she did a remarkable act of wearing / not wearing them. Comments / feedback welcome please to help unravel this

Soundmanpt 23 Sep 2016, 08:53

gwgs

The show ran all summer long 3 nights a week and they also had a live look in show they called "Big Brother after Dark" which was on late in the evening in my area but where the show was coming from it ran from 9 PM to Midnight every night.

When the show firs started there was 8 young ladies and 8 men. Each week one was eliminated. Of the other 7 young ladies 5 of them wore glasses at least part time. Michelle was 2nd to Nichole in how much she wore her glasses.

I'm glad you posted the pictures so I wouldn't be accused of making it up.

Willy 06 Sep 2016, 18:33

As wondrous a vision as a legitimately bespectacled Karen Gillan would be, after some investigation, i have to throw a small amount of cold water on the assertion that the glasses in the picture linked below are hers.

The picture posted on the KG Perfect Hair Tumblr account has a date stamp of September 29, 2013, whereas the KG tweets about possibly needing glasses --- met with resounding approval -- were over a year later, in November 2014. One of the replies to one of those tweets gave me the impression that KG may have been wearing a fan's glasses in 2013 so the fan could take a picture of her in them -- weirder things have happened in the scifi/fantasy cosplay world. Also note that KG's head is still mostly shaved in the picture, which would make sense in September 2013 but not November 2014, after GOTG came out.

Finally, given that KG is a fairly active tweeter and free sharer, one might imagine that if she had followed through with an eye test and gotten glasses, she would have tweeted about it later, but her feed never mentions the subject again.

So at present, I'll have to say i think that KG's glasses status is not yet -- but soon?

 31 Jul 2016, 12:03

this is the scene where the "gun battle" takes place and she loses her glasses. And where you say someone comes to help her.

Not even close. She is being hit by a police baton during a school protest, and she loses her glasses. No one comes to help her. She runs into the arms of blurry police officers and is arrested.

it "sounds" like you mixed your fantasies and reality into your memory of this film.

Soundmanpt 30 Jul 2016, 18:20

Maria

First of all thank you so much for finding that. It couldn't have been very easy to find because I was even incorrect about how she met up with what turned out to be her bf. As soon as i saw thew name of the movie as being "Katherine" it instantly rang a bell for me that you had found the movie I was referring to. You must have watched some or most of it to even find the part I had so wrong where she had to remove one of her contacts and he convinced her to put on her glasses. Clearly the glasses were really not that attractive but at that time that was what many were wearing. I will be making a nice big bowl of popcorn and fixing a big glass of diet soda and sit back and watch that before I go to bed in about an hour. You really made my day by finding that. Kind of a dark sad movie with a not so great ending, but because of the glasses part a very interesting movie considering that when that movie was made hardly any movie ever had a leading lady wearing glasses. Again thank you. That was very nice of you to take time to find that for me.

María 30 Jul 2016, 13:51

Hi Soundmanpt!

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0073229/

Soundmanpt 30 Jul 2016, 11:51

Not sure exactly where to post my question but this thread seems the closest.

Anyway maybe 10 years ago or so I saw a movie on TV and in fact I saw a couple of times, but I have no idea what the name of it was. Anyway it was based on Vietnam protesters mostly protesting at colleges and things. The female lead was a very attractive young college girl and as best I can recall she was sitting on a bench outside and young man she didn't know approached and started chatting with her. After a bit she started having problems with one of her contact lenses and the guy told her that if she had her glasses with her she should just put them on. She did have her glasses and changed to them. The guy told her how nice she looked wearing glasses and that she should just stop messing with contacts and wear glasses. She quickly seemed to like the guy and she took his advice and proceeded to wear her glasses from then on. He was with a protest group and she soon joined the group and he seemed to be the leader of the group She soon was taking part in not only protests but doing several violent things as well where guns even came into play. Thye were even up against soldiers and during the course of time she even changed her glasses to a round wire rim glasses. At one point she in a gun battle her glasses somehow come off and she well enough to find them and her bf has to come and rescue her. I think in the end they both get killed but not sure. Does anybody know what movie I am describing? I would love to know and even better if they could post an attachment to view the movie. Thanks to all in advance.

Just nice to see that so many women are leaving their glasses on more often now.

The new seaon of "Big Brother" just started up and nice to see several of the young ladies in their wearing glasses. The best one of them all is Nichol for last season. She is an ER nurse and her glasses show quite a bit of cut-in. She wore glasses last year as well but she has new gone now. She has her glasses on full tiem except when she is doing a challenge. They so far have never shown her changing from glasses to contacts but there is very little doubt that she wouldn't be able to compete without either glasses or contacts. The challenges they do usually wouldn't be safe to be wearing glasses. But it really appears that Nichol must really prefer wearing her glasses because as soon as a challenge is over she is back wearing her glasses.

lensed up 15 Jun 2016, 09:54

Carrie, you may want to check out another of Woody's films called 'Interiors'. It's a dramatic film about three sisters, one of whom wears her real eyeglasses in the movie. Actress Mary Beth Hurt wears rimless frames holding minus lenses of about -5.0 D throughout the film.

Soundmanpt 13 Jun 2016, 10:54

Carrie

Yes I agree that was the reason I bought the movie because those glasses looked so good on her. But I assume she must feel as if they aren't her style, but who knows? Anyway I thought I heard something about a new movie either out or about to come out that was written and directed by Woody Allen and i googled it and sure enough there is a ne movie coming out. It is called "Cafe Society" and it stars a number of people including Steve carell and Sheryl Lee. It is set in the 30's and i did watch a trailer but didn't see any females wearing glasses except for sunglasses from that time frame.

You may recall one of his more famous movies was "Annie Hall" which starred a very young Diane Keaton and she pretty much wore glasses throughout the movie. They were even romantically involved for several years. Ever since that movie Miss Keaton is hardly ever seen without glasses. And she wears glasses in nearly if not all of the movies she has been in since as well. Makes me wonder what influence he may have had in convincing her to wear glasses back when they were together?

Alfred Hitchcock was also a producer/director that often featured his leading ladies wearing glasses. You may recall that in one of his biggest movies "Stranger on the Train" more than one young lady was wearing glasses. One star that was murdered even wore very real, very strong glasses for her role. She had perfect eyesight and the glasses wer so strong that she had to hold on to things just to shoot the scenes because she couldn't see anything with the glasses. I believe he even had his own daughter in the movie as well and she was also wearing glasses throughout.

Soundmanpt 13 Jun 2016, 07:00

Carrie

I'm not so sure that the glasses Scarlett Johansson wore in the movie "Scoop" were fake. I bought a copy of that movie and in doing a lot of slow motion and freeze framing it sure appeared that her had a prescription. Remember that movie was produced by Woody Allen and he always seemed to have his leading ladies wearing glasses on screen. The cost of fitting an actress with glasses in her own prescription was a small cost in the making of a movie. It was during the filming of this movie that Woody gifted her with a pair of his old glasses which she was thrilled to receive and she claimed that she even wore them with his prescription lenses in them until she got around to having her own prescription put into them.

Carrie 11 Apr 2016, 13:51

One of the "boys" at work keeps going on about how hot Nancy from Eastenders is. (For non-UK readers Eastenders is a very popular tv soap/drama set in a fictional part of London's east end). I don't watch it so I Googled her. Nancy is played by an actress called Maddy Hill. She is very pretty and I have discovered that she wears glasses sometimes! I don't know if she ever wears glasses on the show but I'm guessing she doesn't.

She appears to have a moderate minus prescription in her left lens and a very weak prescription or even none at all in the right lens.

Tom1 07 Mar 2016, 15:41

Watching a TV movie this evening when a character appeared, a female journalist around mid 40, wearing glasses... Real minus prescription glasses!

Googled about her and found some pictures with glasses, so she is really near sighted. Moreover she was wearing in the movie the same frame she has in several pictures including some shows where she was performing, so they are their real prescription glasses!

Her name is Teresa Mannino, in this page there is one of her better pictures (descarding those where she is not bespectacled, obviously!)

http://pinkitalia.it/pinkpower/teresa-mannino-a-pinkitalia-far-ridere-e-bello-scatena-energia-come-lamore/

Enjoy

Carrie

In looking at her glasses through her left lens which is really the only one you can really see completely through her glasses don't really appear to be all that strong. Yes there is some expected magnification but not all that much. My best guess is around +3.50 or +3.75, but you're probably right in saying that she probably needs to be wearing her glasses full time if she can't see any better than what she was claiming. It's possible that she does wear her glasses full time and she only took them off because she is a celebrity and most people recognize her best without glasses.

Carrie 07 Mar 2016, 11:08

Amber Tamblyn's sight must be slightly worse than mine if the man in the audience looked a little fuzzy without her glasses. Possibly worse than my cousin's sight (hers is a little worse than mine). We both need our glasses full time so Amber probably should be wearing hers full time. Maybe she doesn't mind everything being a little fuzzy but it's too fuzzy to read so she has to wear her glasses for that. Without my glasses everything is just slightly out of focus but, like Amber, I can't read without my glasses.

Anyone like to suggest what Amber's prescription could be?

Carrie 15 Feb 2016, 10:28

I watched the first hour of the BAFTAs last night and Kate Winslet came on to present an award with Idris Elba. Kate looked beautiful and Idris looked quite nice too, actually (I maybe a woman who prefers women but there's still a bit of me that can admire a good looking man). Kate said something about not having her glasses and then Idris put his hand inside his jacket and took out Kate's glasses from the inside pocket. Kate put her glasses on to read the autocue, looking really gorgeous. Unfortunately she had taken her glasses off by the time the clips of the nominees had finished playing and she was going to announce the winner. Lovely while it lasted.

Off topic - it shocked me to hear that Kate's school drama teacher told her at the age of 14 she would do ok if she settled for the fat girl parts. What a horrible and stupid thing to say to a teenage girl! As a curvy girl myself I really admire Kate as she has proven that NORMAL shaped girls can be successful and beautiful (which she still is at the age of 40). I'm sure Kate's husband loves her curves and many men (and some women) are perhaps a little bit jealous of him. My girlfriend loves my curves. She may not be as curvy as me but she's not skinny either and I love her.

Lv2c4i 12 Jan 2016, 05:44

The award show season with its opportunities for celebrity spec sightings has begun. At the recent "Golden Globes", winner Maura Tierney began her acceptance speech saying, "I'm such a 'four-eyes'...I hate it." as she pushed her spex up. Thanks Maura for the willingness to wear your stylish spex for us all, especially OOs, to enjoy. I wonder whether a more attentive optician/fitter could help her with spex not quite so prone to slide down annoyingly. Nonetheless, she does rock the glasses which do look best when they are sitting properly for her eyes and face.

Lv2c4i 31 Dec 2015, 05:45

As I enjoy Speximan's posts, I note the choice of uninspired choice of frames for "Supergirl"--they barely fit her face and certainly are not the least bit stylish. If memory serves way back when, when Wonder Woman first arrived, her spex were also simply for the disguising the superheroine, but later Linda Carter began to wear more and more stylish and contemporary frames. Perhaps Supergirl will follow her path as time marches on.

Soundmanpt 10 Dec 2015, 10:43

Speximann

The soap opera "Days of our Lifes" has quite a history of young ladies on the show wearing glasses from time to time. The show is taped on a daily basis so if a cast member has a contact lens problem they usually just wear their real glasses. I recall some years ago the young daughter on the show I believe her name was Brittney Snow. A cute petite blond girl suddenly wore glasses for a full day and nothing was in the story line to explain why she was now wearing glasses. I made a point to watch the next day and sure enough now she wasn't wearing glasses. So she must have had some type of contact lens problem and you could clearly tell that her glasses were not all that weak. But there have been countless others out of nowhere suddenly be wearing glasses for a day or 2 and then not again. So I would bet that the glasses that Arianna Zucker is wearing are her own glasses that she wears in real life.

Carrie 08 Dec 2015, 14:55

Soundmanpt

We like the show because she is a female superhero. Too many male superheroes! That's nothing to do with us being gay women, just us being women.

I agree that big Hipster glasses wouldn't look right but frames that were just a little wider would be better.

That scene in "Not Another Teen Movie" is obviously mocking all those cheesy films where the female becomes 'more beautiful' when her glasses come off and her hair is let down.

Yes, I did know Calista Flockhart was married to Harrison Ford. He's a lucky man, she's very pretty. She's lucky too as he's very handsome and seems to be a genuinely nice person in interviews I've seen. I don't know what she's like in real life. My mum fancies him and my dad fancies Calista!

Soundmanpt 08 Dec 2015, 11:10

Carrie

I'm sure you were enjoying every minute while you were discussing "Supergirl's" glasses with 3 other very attractive young ladies that all wear glasses and you fancy all 3 of them. Like you girls I have to admit to being a fan of the show as well. When I first saw promos of the show I was really afraid that they would only have her wearing glasses at limited times, but to my surprise she is wearing glasses the majority of the time in every episode so far. She really only takes her glasses off when she is Supergirl. Early on I read that the reason she wears glasses is not only as a disguise but her glasses minimizes her laser eyes. This I assume is why she even has her glasses on when she is alone in her apartment or with James. She commented once before the show even aired that she had to try on a huge number of glasses before they decided the perfect ones for her to wear. Personally I have to disagree with you ladies about her glasses being too big for her face. I really think they are the perfect size for her. If they had gone with the larger size "hipster" glasses I think they would have looked fake and the whole idea of Supergirl is hard enough to believe so if her glasses looked fake that wouldn't help sell the show. Of course that is only my opinion.

A few things you may find of interest. You mentioned that it would be nice if her adoptive sister also wore glasses. Funny I have thought the same thing myself while watching the show. I had a look at her twitter page that you attached and it appears that she must wear glasses or contacts full time when off camera based on the number of pictures of her wearing glasses. Are you aware that Chyler Leigh is the same girl that was the lead actress several years ago in a very popular movie. You may want to look it up at some point. The name of the movie is "Not Another Teen movie" For about the first half of the movie she is a teen girl that doesn't seem to have much interest in her appearance and wears bib overalls, with her hair up and of course glasses and no makeup. A friend of a friend's gf come over to give her a makeover. Of course the first hing she does is remove her glasses. In the movie they even have her remove her glasses in slow motion for effect. Then the hair is let down and she gives her head a shake and her hair looks perfect. A little makeup and a nice dress and like magic she is transformed into a godest. Funny thing is that the glasses she wore in the movie look exactly like the glasses she has on in her twitter pictures. So she must have liked the glasses she wore in that movie if she wears nearly the same today. Also I don't have a clue why Calista Flockhart has so many pairs of glasses on her desk all the time. I assume because she is so rich she has all different styles to pick from? But did you know that she is married to Harrison Ford? They have been married since 2004. Mr. Ford is about to appear in the new "Star Wars" movie which opens here on December 18th.

Me and Gemma were chatting with our friends Danielle and the coffee shop server at the weekend and we happened to get on to the subject of Supergirl. We all fancy her as the superhero and as the timid office girl. Danielle said that Kara could do with different glasses as the ones she wears seem a little small for her face. I happened to come across an old TV show that must have aired in the 70's. She plays a high school teacher that has super powers much like "Wonder Woman" As the teacher she wears glasses pretty much full time but she does sometimes manage to take them off for no apparent reason. You can find episodes of this show on You Tube. The name of the show is "The Secrets of Isis" (It has nothing to do with the terrorists group.)

Wurm 31 Oct 2015, 12:15

Speaking of Hitchcock, those famous glasses from Strangers on a Train are at the Movie Madness video store here in Portland, as documented by the actress, Kasey Rogers:

> The name of his store is Movie Madness Video and More and it's nice to know that my glasses are on display at his wonderful video store. He went ahead and had the glasses, along with a picture of me wearing them from the movie, all mounted nicely - right next to the knife from PSYCHO.

http://moviemadnessvideo.com/about/celebrity-testimonials/page/3/

I bowled for years on a team sponsored by Movie Madness. It's really an amazing place.

Wurm 31 Oct 2015, 11:59

Melissa Sue Anderson is featured as a nosy neighbor obsessed with crime stories, in an episode of the 80s version of "Alfred Hitchcock Presents":

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJCKgrnys-A

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f07RuJ-VGCw

The series doesn't seem to have been re-released in any video format. I saw this episode on cable years ago and never forgot it, although key details like the name of the series and the actress had slipped my mind.

Anderson is cute in pajamas and preppy frames, and the story is funny.

The series, which ran about 1985-88, has quite a few characters with glasses.

Edie 27 Oct 2015, 12:14

Specs4Me

That Hitchcock movie made a very long time ago, I think most of the things has changed in Hollywood since then.

I have some actor friends, they are not famous at all, but trying to make it in LA.

One of them had some little parts in TV series and bad movies. He wears glasses IRL, he's shortsighted, maybe 2-3 dpt. Some of his characters have glasses, but they always tell him, not to wear his real glasses, because their reflections are not the same as the props with the plano. But I guess it depends on the role, and the director, too.

Annoying One 27 Oct 2015, 12:07

Specs4Me

For future reference, the movie is called "Strangers on a Train." :-)

It's also said that the actress kept a pair of the thick glasses that are in a museum in Portland, Oregon.

Specs4Me 27 Oct 2015, 11:46

I think the movie was Murder on the Train in which Alfred Hitchcock had the main character wear very strong glasses that were not hers, she stated in an interview that she could see nothing when wearing the glasses. She mentioned that she would have her hand on the counter whenever possible to help orient herself. The fact is that there have been situations in which actors/actresses have worn glasses that were not their real prescription but only for as short a time as necessary.

I agree that in the scene on the roof there was a slight minification in the left lens, indicating that she is mildly nearsighted. I suspect that she is quite able to function without correction much of the time that she is not wearing glasses and that for scenes when she needs good vision she is wearing contacts. Just my $0.02 worth.

Soundmanpt 27 Oct 2015, 11:35

Unnamed

I really don't think they would ever have their actress wear prescription glasses just to make the scene more realistic when most people other than us crazies in here are likely the only ones that pays any attention to such things. Also in filming a scene that is only a few seconds on air can sometimes take numerous takes to get right so longer than what you may think.

I have been to tapings of several TV shows that are filmed in front of live audiences and you may find it interesting to know that most all of them are taped in front of 3 different audiences and then they spice the best of the 3 together. And of course during each taping they will often stop and reshoot if a mistake is made. Oh and besides the 3 tapings in front of live audiences they also do a brief run without an audience.

That show that aired last night likely took at least 3 - 4 weeks to film. This is why most shows only run for about 12 weeks because it takes so long to film each one.

 27 Oct 2015, 11:01

No it doesn't mean Supergirl is nearsighted.

Hollywood actors often wear prescription glasses as props to look authentic; it doesn't matter whether the actress needs them or not. You might be horrified by this, but consider each scene is filmed separately for only a few seconds to a few minutes. So the strain of wearing glasses is not that bad.

Assuming she is really nearsighted might be a mistake for another reason... at least 3/4 of the show she is not wearing glasses. The heavier weight toward scenes without glasses makes me wonder if she really needs them at all.

eyesnap 27 Oct 2015, 09:14

http://girlswithglasses.com/tv-tuesday-ntsf-sd-suv/

Soundmanpt 27 Oct 2015, 09:07

Carrie

I watched the first episode of "Supergirl" and as I expected she mostly only wears her glasses when she is at work, but she also tends to leave them on while at home and at times as well. I didn't record the show but watched closely to see if the glasses she wears has any prescription in them. Finally with about 6 or 7 minutes left James Olson (aka Jimmy Olsen) while at work asks her to meet him on the roof. At that point he lets her know that he knows that she is the cousin of Superman. During there chat the camera gets behind her in such a way the your able to see through her left lens of her glasses and you can see that things are indeed minified meaning that she is nearsighted and her glasses are very real.

An added bonus of sorts is that Calista Flockhart who plays her boss also can be seen for a few seconds wearing some readers which also are clearly very real. For those that don't know she is married to Harrison Ford and has been for some time now. Like you say Carrie for being 50 she still looks very good.

The autumnal roll out of new shows and new seasons of old shows here in the USA is always an opportunity to discover and enjoy actors in spex. For instance, Supergirl will likely have plenty of 'Clark Kent' moments for the title character. Spex may also show up on actresses who were bare-eyed up to now (I recall both Law and Order SVU and The Good Wife offering such moments)and new glasses/frames on others who had been bespectacled (Modern Family).

Tom1 19 Sep 2015, 15:15

OMG found and interview when she also state her prescription -2 and -2.5. She says she could not read a teleprompt at all! However she has been told this is not a problem for her job since nearsighted actress have deeper, more intense eyes.

Tom1 19 Sep 2015, 15:10

P.S. found one posted by herself https://mobile.twitter.com/vaneincontrada/status/598765088452009984

Tom1 19 Sep 2015, 15:07

Spanish-Italian actress Vanessa Incontrada guest on a TV show tonight was asked to sing a song. She complained she didn't have her glasses (!). Another show woman (in her sixties) handed over her reading glasses and poor Vanessa admitted she could see even worst with them since she needs for distance cause che is shortsighted and astigmatic. At the end, a paper with the text of the song was handed to her and she was able to sing reading at quite normal distance from her eyes so she should not be that blind.

Looked around for a picture of bespectacled Vanessa but wasn't able to find.

Jonesie62 09 Aug 2015, 14:43

RKCity72,

Thanks for posting the Charlie's Angels episode here, showing Jacyln Smith in the eyewear:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tqXH4rH2mCI

Though I know a lot of people here might not appreciate the lack of power in the lenses (actually no power, from what it appears), I think the style of the frames and the shaded tint fit the times. I remember watching this as a young teen and thinking "are the glasses real?". Eventually, I pretty much realized they were not a real prescription for her. However, I appreciate show giving the opportunity to leave a lot to the imagination.

Carrie 03 Aug 2015, 15:32

Eleanor Tomlinson, Demelza in BBC's Poldark http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2015/04/26/15/27DFDFC900000578-0-image-a-133_1430057581703.jpg

I had a feeling she might wear glasses but this is the only photo I've seen with her wearing them. Obviously she isn't going to wear them in Poldark as the story is set about 200 years ago! I have to admit that Aiden Turner, who plays the title character, is one of a very few men who I find attractive.

In another BBC drama, Partners In Crime (Sundays on BBC1), Jessica Raine (Best known in the UK as being in Call The Midwife) is one half of a Husband and Wife amateur detective partnership. Her character sometimes wears reading glasses. The glasses don't always appear when they should, as is quite common in tv dramas. The drama is set in the 1950s. Here's a photo http://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/tvandradioblog/2015/jul/26/partners-in-crime-sunday-night-escapism-tommy-and-tuppence#img-1

KL 28 Jul 2015, 09:39

On the general topic of actresses and glasses - isn't it frustrating how often they *don't* wear glasses on screen although they do the rest of the time? I get that they're held to certain standards of beauty/appearance more demanding than for the general population (not saying I *agree* with them, though), but the characters that are created are even more 'unreal' in that sense.

To take Orange is the New Black as an example, I've seen pictures of several of the actresses in glasses off screen and yet the only ones to also wear them on the show are Lori Petty (whatever her character's name is - can't remember) and Red to a small extent.

KL 28 Jul 2015, 09:30

Soundmanpt - Laura Prepon's glasses are plano/props. Her character Alex is nearsighted and wears them pretty much all the time - in one episode I think she called herself "moderately blind" without them.

I don't pay extra for the cable show she is on now. (Orange is the New Black) so I keep hoping at some point it may star to shown on a regular cable network. She wears glasses quite often on this show, I have never heard if the glasses are only props or if they are prescription glasses? Has anyone ever seen any comments about her glasses?

Melyssa 07 Jun 2015, 08:09

Also last week on Match Game '79, Nancy Lowe, a contestant originally from Minnesota, wore very large brown/orange/tortoiseshell frames, something similar to what I had two years later. Her prescription was very strong, as evidenced by the power rings when the camera showed her close up at a 45-degree angle. On her second day, host Gene Rayburn asked her if she had gotten new glasses. She said no, that they were still the same pair. Old Gene really had trouble with eyewear last week. It's as though he had been wearing Brett Somers' strong glasses.

Carrie 24 May 2015, 17:17

I wouldn't say I was an expert, just someone that finds her extremely attractive. But I have seen a lot of photos of her mostly with glasses on. I can't tell for sure if any of the frames she's worn over the last few years had prescription lenses. Sometimes it does look like she has prescription lenses. I have read that extract from an interview before where she admits the glasses she is wearing are non-prescription. That was a few years ago and she could need a prescription now.

I agree she does look better without loads of makeup on.(I prefer women who don't wear loads of makeup. I feel they are trying to hide something if they wear heavy makeup) She's naturally beautiful - fantastic bone structure. She chooses her glasses well. The character she played in a recent film wore glasses similar in style to the ones she often wears in real life. I wonder if she got the job of promoting Chanel eyewear because she is so often seen wearing fashionable glasses?

Soundmanpt 24 May 2015, 10:29

I am not a big fan of Kristen Stewart even though at times i find her very attractive. She is actually one of those young ladies that really look much better without the tons of makeup. But there have been so many pictures of her wearing glasses over there past few years and the ones where you can get a decent closeup of her glasses they sure seem to have a low distance prescription in them. I think she is nearsighted (shortsigted) and just doesn't want to admit it for some reason. Maybe she thinks it will make her less than perfect, who knows?

Carrie is the real expert on Kristen. So what say you?

Soundmanpt 17 May 2015, 10:18

I just the first trailer for "Supergirl" and nice to see that the young female star seems to wear glasses most all the time except when she changes into "Supergirl" Even better from what I was able to tell in a few close ups of her wearing glasses the glasses she wears seems to have prescription lenses, meaning they are in her real prescription of course. I like it that don't try and downplay her glasses by making them appear on the ugly side. Her glasses are in fact very trendy and she looks very cute wearing them. This is a new series coming in the fall. I look forward to watching it.

Also a made for TV movie is currently running on the Lifetime Channel. The name of the movie is "The Wrong Girl" and it features 2 late aged teens becoming friends. They are both really attractive and one of them wears a pair of really stylish Ray Bans in a modern day style cat-eye shape. Nice to see that that is no doubt the glasses she is wearing is in her prescription. More than one view through her lenses where you can clearly see everything is minified.

So nice to see more and more shows featuring attractive young ladies wearing glasses.

gwgs 26 Jan 2015, 09:12

Galileo - likewise! Her big and bright glasses were very iconic, and a thing of beauty. My interest also waned until Julia Haworth appeared on screen playing the role Claire Peacock - she also had a penchant for big bold glasses but after watching several episodes I got tired of it and haven't seen it since then.

A word re: the malware - I would advise everyone to be careful when opening links to third party sites that aren't verifiable by being a big name (i.e. iconosquare, vk.com etc are all safe as they are big companies). The malware problem I reported last week or so ago has caused me to get my it company to completely rebuild the pc as neither I or they can find the bugs in the system that have caused the computer to malfunction since that day! Not what you're expecting when you're browsing what you think are innocent websites!

Galileo 26 Jan 2015, 08:17

@gwg sorry to hear about your malware problems. My recollection of Anne Kirkbride was that she wore real glasses when she first appeared in the soap, and that was the one and only thing which got me interested in what was my grandmother's favourite program.

My interest waned as soon as she switched to contacts and plano lenses.

gwgs 20 Jan 2015, 02:52

PC still f****d from yesterday with that damn webpage. Even though I've got anti virus on here, and a firewall, I cannot remove "omiga-plus" which has placed itself as a toolbar on my browser, and caused a couple of other problems!

The real reason for posting here this morning though is that Anne Kirkbride has passed away after a short illness, and the relatively young age of 60. Back in the day when wearing big glasses wasn't fashionable, there was Anne Kirkbride - who played Deidre Barlow on Coronation Street - wearing a variety of big frames that brought her a lot of attention from the media. She was a real icon in the acting / soap world, and will be sorely missed. RIP.﻿

In her youth she was nicknamed "Miss Sexy Spex" and attracted a lot of attention from the media for her choice of big / oversized glasses. I even recall about 15 years ago one of the tabloid newspapers in England having a centre spread featuring all the different glasses she had worn over the years. She was a soap icon, and less importantly, a great believer in big is better glasses.

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/film-news/gallery/anne-kirkbride-who-played-deirdre-8477715#ICID=sharebar_google+

kisal 09 Dec 2014, 07:26

Saw an amazing movie last night called "Clouds of Sils Maria": http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2452254/ It is a French film, but most of the dialogue is in English. Cinematically it is very good, but what makes it amazing is Kristen Stewart who wears very nice glasses for, I would say 80% of her screen time (and she is the second-billed star after Juliette Binoche). I was of course annoyed when she took them off, but at least the timing of removing them usually made sense for her character, when swimming, at the end of the day when she was tired, etc. There is a wonderful montage of her bespectacled face as she is driving in the rain and fog.

Here are some links:

http://www.filmofilia.com/four-new-clouds-of-sils-maria-photos-kristen-stewart-juliette-binoche-173525/

http://www.hitfix.com/in-contention/review-kristen-stewart-is-best-in-show-in-airy-clouds-of-sils-maria

http://www.awardsdaily.com/blog/tag/clouds-of-sils-maria/

and there are of course many more to be googled.

Soundmanpt 06 Dec 2014, 10:19

I used to watch "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" all the time and I always hoped since she played a college girl that at some point they might have her character wearing glasses at least while she was in class. Of courser that never happened but who knew that at 19 her vision was so bad that when she was found to need glasses that her optometrists told her she was "as blind as a bat" and that she was likely wearing glasses full time off camera. Funny that it took so many years for this to come out and yet she doesn't seem to mind it being known.

Crystal Veil 03 Dec 2014, 15:59

As someone in the US who was very aware of the beautiful glasses made in the mid-50s thru the mid-60s (I was born in 1942) I can tell you that in the late 60s women threw away their beautiful cat eye glasses and replaced them with granny glasses so they could look like John Lennon. I'm still scrathing my head trying to figure out that one.

It was really hard to find any of these old cat eye glasses until eBay. Using eBay I've built up a nice collection of these glasses in good enough shape that opticians have been able to put lenses in them, and they look good. Also, Shuron is still making a nice cat eye that they've made all along. Look for NuLady and NuLady DeLuxe. These frames are available new online in the $60.00 to $90.00 Price range.

If you ever want to use some of these beautiful old glasses in one of your photo-shoots, let me know and I will lend you a few.

I've enjoy all your photo-shoots. I thought the last two were especially good.

OMG, just got g/f new glasses...Zenni has tons of great cat eyes !! Never actually bought from them before, but their customer service asked more questions then the stores and dr do !! They even commented about different reading pd needed for single vision reading rx, since she don't want bifocals.

Stay warm in Philly...just cancelled a trip up there for tonight brrrrrr

Melyssa 03 Dec 2014, 05:45

Here in the Eastern Time Zone of the good old USA, the only cat's-eyes I have seen live and in color besides my own have been some at my favorite eyewear establishment, but I will not dole out $300 for a complete pair, even if they had blue ones, which is my top desire at this time. I found that out when I was there and a woman a bit younger than I am wore large black cat's-eyes, and the optician told me what the price was.

gwgs 03 Dec 2014, 02:03

CV and soundman - the cat eye still also disappeared long ago from the UK, but there has been a resurgence with the new bolder black frame, designers such as Derek Cardigan & Tom Ford seem to have sold bucket loads of their modern designs of this classic style over the last couple of years.

For you two searching for the original classic cat eye frame, there are plenty of them selling on eBay.com - just doing a basic search in their "Vision Care" category under the "used" sub category shows there are 100 listed!

http://www.ebay.com/sch/Vision-Care-/31414/i.html?_sop=10&_udhi=50&LH;_FS=0&_from=R40-R40-R40&_nkw=cateye&_pgn=2&_skc=50&rt;=nc

astigmaphile 02 Dec 2014, 17:48

Crystal Veil,

I have been collecting used glasses fromm thrift stores for over three years. I have only one pair of cat eyes and the plastic has cracks in it.Plus and minus lenticulars are something that I have never found.

Crystal Veil 02 Dec 2014, 16:13

Soundmanpt,

you live in the USA or am I mistaken? Amazing to hear that you came across lots of vintage cat eye glasses only a few years ago. In the Netherlands, cat eye glasses disappeared from those charity boxes during the 1980's and most glasses from that era in my collection are broken because the old plastics simply started to crumble. Did cat eye glasses remain fashionable in your area long after the mid 1960's? What you write about opticians digging in charity boxes themselves makes sense to me. Over the years, I understood that this is done by some opticians here as well, albeit not on a large scale. Sorry if this is all off topic for other readers of this thread about actresses.

Soundmanpt 02 Dec 2014, 12:05

eyesnap

I really love the glasses they have come up with for her character to wear. I used to see a good number of them a few years ago turn up in the donation boxes I would be picking up. I finally after good while started hanging onto a number of the ones in good condition.

After a while I found that many of the opticians were going through the box before I came to make my pickup. They even told me they did it. Kind of asking if it was okay to take them. We were lucky they allowed us to keep a box in there store so I couldn't tell them no even if I wanted to. This was back in the days when many of the stores had their own lab in house so many of the girls would come across glasses in the box and have their lab guy cut new lenses in their prescription so they could wear them.

Speximann 19 Nov 2014, 15:11

SoundManpt, sadly that's the world of TV, Movies, & Advertising. Alot of Women have been programed to believe anything other than the status quo isn't sexy,attractive, or marketable. A website I stumbled onto years back from a post on this site has some beautiful models sometimes wearing glasses for the effect of their content. At that time I questioned the fact that lots (but not all) of the shoots in which the girls wore glasses were done with lens-less frames which looked pretty stupid for a site specializing in "Tease" type photo shoots. Happy to say that almost never happens now. Some of their regular models wear their own glasses in their shoots although none have a very strong Rx, but they now use a good selection of planos which is tons better than lens-less frames. Their photographer is very good at shooting these ladies & managing the glare.

Even more odd in several of the caps you posted they didn't bother getting AR coating (anti-reflective) put on her lenses and you can even see the studio lights reflecting off of them badly.

Melyssa 14 Nov 2014, 05:52

Soundmanpt,

Don't worry about that jealous jughead from 1999. My husband and I make a lot of good use of our DVR/VCR, whether it's to record something on TV late or to play our plethora of programs from way back when (with "Batman" due to be delivered in a day or so).

Lv2c4i 14 Nov 2014, 05:33

In a restaurant yesterday I glanced up at the TV that was on in the corner and was pleased to see a woman wearing glasses. This got my attention and as I watched, I saw it was a CNN clip of Mariska Hargitay from 'Law and Order SVU'. I've long thought that she was a hottie and she's been one of the women I've hoped to someday see in glasses. So, I checked around the inet a bit and found a few pix of her in various pairs of glasses on Twitter.

Julianna Margulies of 'The Good Wife' is another attractive (imho) actress who I'd never seen wearing spex over the years, but, spurred on by the Mariska discovery, I did a bit of twitter-ing and found that she had also just recently appeared wearing glasses.

On Twitter there were tons of tweets about how wonderful these women looked in their eyewear and imploring the directors of their respective TV shows to have them wear glasses often, even always.

Maybe some of our generous cappers can/will post pix of these two hotties wearing their spex.

gwgs 14 Nov 2014, 02:45

Soundman - I think you can get your DVD player 'chipped' which means it will work as a multi region player. I don't know how its done but as another person has suggested, Google it and see.

I always ensure that my Blu-ray players are multi region for precisely this region as you therefore don't have to worry about whether those DVDs you bought at the airport, or on eBay US will work.

With regard to Arrow, I don't know what season these stills were from as I didn't note anything from the blurb that went with the video, but I've favourited them on my YouTube Channel, so you can find them there if you want to see them - http://www.youtube.com/sexygirlswithglasses

When I got home last night I flicked on the TV and ironically happened to see an advert for "the all new series Arrow" on Sky. This is showing either on Sky Atlantic, or Sky One - can't remember, but this will be the first series of which it has already been noted she is wearing prescription glasses in.

There was a similarly strange occurrence with a young lady and her glasses in a show I used to watch when I was at college. The show was called Hollyoaks and featured a sexy young beauty - Lisa Kay who played Anna Green, a vicars daughter who was a student at a sixth form college. During her several year stint on this soap, she wore - iirc - 8 different pairs of glasses all in the same large round style. Sometimes they would have a plano appearance to them, and sometimes I could quite distinctly see a prescription in them. Like you Soundman, I used to watch, with my eyes peeled fascinated by this young beauty and her (in this case) big glasses, and to my delight found on a webchat session that she confirmed that she did wear glasses off screen, but she was very rarely seen with them (must have been a contact lens wearer). It obviously served the casting director well that she wore glasses, as she played a geeky, downtrodden girl, and her glasses added quite a bit to this character they wanted to portray.

As you might expect from me, I have a photostream of vidcaps I made back in the day of her - http://www.flickr.com/photos/lisakayfan

Thanks to both "oliquinn" and "GWG" for your research on "Felicity" Sadly I only recently came across this show as I don't watch all that much TV except really late, not much prime time. But once i came across this show i have tried to make a point to be home at the time it airs because of her. I am not even sure how many seasons it has been airing. "oliquinn" said that in the first season the glasses she was wearing appeared to be a plus prescription, but more recent ones she is wearing plano lenses. Not sure why they would decide to do that if she really has a need for glasses.

I must assume then that the videos I came across might have been more recent shows because I am sure when I stopped the action at various points where you could see through her lenses at things in the background there was no distortion at all and they appeared to be plano. However seeing the stills that "GWG" sent her glasses very much do appear to have prescription lenses. So I wonder if those pictures are from season one then and "oliquinn "is correct that for some reason she now wears plano lenses. I guess we can maybe assume that after the first season she could have gotten lasik or something and no longer requires glasses?

At any rate, thanks again.

Soundman - I had never heard of this show, but searched for it on YouTube and out of the several videos I picked, it seemed fairly evident that she was wearing plus prescription lenses, with refraction evident.

I took 10 vidcaps of her showing this, including two views through her lenses, which again shows distortion through her lenses - something that wouldn't be evident in non prescription lenses.

Soundmanpt 12 Nov 2014, 13:05

Last week the "Arrow" TV show featured the glasses wearing female star. It showed her as a very pretty young lady sexy casual look much like she maybe had just graduated from College. But she was not yet wearing glasses. You were left to assume that her job working at a computer must have brought on the need for her to now need glasses.

The real shame is that recently i viewed many of the previous shows on You Tube and I tried to se if the glasses she wears has any kind of prescription in them. It took a lot of stopping at just the right point trying to see through her lenses at the perfect angle to see if anything behind her appeared minified or out of focus but even things in the background with straight edges were unchanged through her glasses meaning they had no visible prescription. So it must mean one of two things. Either her vision is so bad that they don't want her tobe seen wearing very strong glasses or she has good vision still and doesn't need glasses. Most like she doesn't need glasses. if she did need a real prescription I would think because her character wears glasses full time the would allow her to wear glasses in her real prescription.

Melyssa 27 Oct 2014, 12:56

Marcia Strassman, may she rest in peace, wore glasses on "Welcome Back, Kotter" from January of 1976 through the end of the 1977-78 season. During that last season she switched from those metal aviators to large plastic frames in different colors. Unfortunately, she stopped wearing glasses and cut her hair short for the final season. (My husband thought that was the cause of the lower ratings, not caring that Gabe Kaplan and John Travolta hardly made appearances.)

Soundmanpt, "Bailey Quarters" is Jan Smithers, whom I do not recall having worn glasses outside of her role.

Soundmanpt 27 Oct 2014, 10:48

A.P.

Being from that generation I very well recall Ms. Strassman and her very big and very real glasses that she usually always wore. To be honest it was the only reason I watched the show even though it was pretty funny. It was rare back then to ever see an attractive young woman wearing glasses and even more rare for them to be in a prescription.

Around the same time another show featured an attractive young woman also wearing prescription glasses. That was Bailey Quarters, I don't recall her real name even, I think they wanted her to wear glasses so she would be less attractive than Loni Anderson, but sadly after a the first year or so she soon was taking her glasses off quite a bit and then didn't seem to need glasses anymore. I think they feared that Miss Anderson might leave the show so they wanted her to become the new "hot" girl in the office so the glasses had to go.

A. P. 27 Oct 2014, 09:33

Sad news today that classy American actress Marcia Strassman has passed away at the age of 66. The older generation among us willl remember Ms. Strassman as Gabe Kaplan's beautiful and cheerfully bespectacled wife on the '70s sitcom "Welcome Back Kotter".

Photos or videos, anyone?

Tom 20 Oct 2014, 13:43

Kelly Lang is participating to a TV show named (translation) dancing with the stars, where she is learning dancing with a professional dancer partner. Well, last episode she was commented that she is not putting herself too much in dancing since she is not improving as other participants. Astonishingly (for me!) she revealed that without her glasses she is not able to recognise which camera she has to look into and this takes her precious time while dancing trying to spot where the camera is instead of concentrating on the dance!

I searched for picture of bespectacled Kelly Lang but didn't find on the web.

Guido 02 Oct 2014, 06:53

Copied from "Rolling Stone" interview with Cristin Milioti:

You were pretty done-up in an outfit and makeup on the show. Did people recognize you for it?

No. I don't dress like that. I wear like the same thing every day, like a shirt and black jeans, and I wear glasses because I can't see and my breasts are nowhere near that large. This happened to me a lot: I would be on the subway or be in the coffee shop or something, and someone would come up to me and ask me if we went to high school together or if they knew me, and that went on for a couple weeks after that episode aired. They could see something.

Cristin appears to have mild exopthalmia sometimes associated with high myopia. Did a Google search, but could find no photos of her wearing glasses.

Soundmanpt 30 Sep 2014, 11:08

RK City 72

It was great to see that episode of Fantasy Island. I remember very well watching that show when it was on back in the 70's. But I never saw that episode. What was interesting was that her glasses were not props. If you look when the camera is behind her and over her left shoulder you can easily see that her left lens has a minus prescription in it. Also if you can tell that her glasses are fitted perfectly to her face, most of the time when someone is wearing prop glasses they really don't even fit all that well.

RK City 72 29 Sep 2014, 01:06

Here is a TV episode that shows a sexy blonde, played by Caren Kaye, wearing wire rimmed aviator style glasses during many parts of the TV show Fantasy Island in the late 70s:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FkGjC4yCxV0

I always have had a thing for seeing young sexy blondes wearing aviator style glasses, and I think this could be one of the situations that could have left an impression on me in the past. One of the names of the duo named episode was called "Double Your Pleasure," in which a man wins a trip to Fantasy Island to spend a weekend with two of the world's most beautiful women. The women supposedly ended up being "twins" so to speak. One did not wear glasses but the other one did. At the time and age that I was at the time, I was actually quietly surprised that one of the women who were considered among one of the world's most beautiful women in which someone would go to Fantasy Island for was an eyeglass wearer. Though the makers of the story were probably just trying to differentiate between the "twins," played by the same actress, I guess episodes like this helped form the great impression on me throughout the years. Anyway, I hope this YouTube viewing sticks around, as I had been wanting to view this again for some time.

Curious 27 Sep 2014, 20:58

A question to those who've seen the popular TV show Prison Break (2005-2008), featuring Wentworth Miller and Sara Wayne Callies in lead roles:

Eyescene has established that Miller is significantly nearsighted. But I swear that I've seen a contact outline in Wayne Callies' eye (she's quite famous for Walking Dead as well) multiple times. Yet I've found no photos of her online wearing glasses. I'm curious - has anyone noticed this before?

Curious 27 Sep 2014, 20:58

A question to those who've seen the popular TV show Prison Break (2005-2008), featuring Wentworth Miller and Sara Wayne Callies in lead roles:

Eyescene has established that Miller is significantly nearsighted. But I swear that I've seen a contact outline in Wayne Callies' eye (she's quite famous for Walking Dead as well) multiple times. Yet I've found no photos of her online wearing glasses. I'm curious - has anyone noticed this before?
